name: ITP004 - Select Fill Placement
template name: ITP004 - Select Fill Placement - Rev A

name: Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ Using the correct and complete set of drawings.
○ All drawings are the latest revision
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS and WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Area has been surveyed, highlighting any areas where excavations should not occur (e.g. exclusion zone).
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.4 - Select Fill Material Source (Under Pavements, Imported)
Acceptance Criteria - Material to meet the following the properties:
Wet strength || Not less than 125 kN wet/dry strength variation less than 40%
○ Production testing of supplied select fill will be: 1 per 1,000t for first 5000t, increase to 1 per 2000t following conforming 5000t of conforming results
AS1152 Sieve Size (mm) || Percentage of mass passing sieve size
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.4 - Select Fill Material Source (Other Locations, Site Won)
Acceptance Criteria - Site won or imported material to be chosen based on the assessment that the material is generally free from clay pockets, and rocks that are fractured and/or weathered.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.5 - Submission of Select Fill Methodology Plan

Acceptance Criteria - Principal Contractor to submit a Select Fill Methodology addressing the criteria listed in Spec cl. 2.3.1. Hold Point to be released by Principal’s Representative after acceptance of Select Fill Methodology.
Inspection/Test Method - Select Fill methodology & verify
Record of conformity - Select Fill methodolog y & this ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Principles Representative to approve works starting in each Separable Portion
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - All excavation and filling are free draining to low points clear of the working area. Sufficient pumps, well-points, or other equipment for work area are de-watered as required.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Cut floor to be inspected for suitability - compacted, firm and dry
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
2.0 - Select Fill Works – Imported Material - Under Pavements
Acceptance Criteria - Each Lot of fill must:
○ Not be greater than 200mm in thickness
○ Material is to maintain within 1% of the optimum moisture content during all steps of placement, compaction, and finishing
○ Placement of material to commence at the crown or the highest side of the pavement, with each lane spread adjacent to the previously placed lane
○ Material to not be contaminated by foreign materials and other contaminants
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Each layer of select fill under pavements is to be inspected with the Principles Representative.
○ A medium size vibrating roller (or larger) is to be used for all proof rolls.
○ At least 5m of longitudinal Select Fill and 500mm of lateral overlap of proof rolling between adjacent areas is needed.
○ At least one working days’ notice is to be provided to schedule the presence of the Principles Representative.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Final layer of Select Fill surface to the required level, grade, and shape with a tolerance of +0mm and -25mm. Intermediate layers of select fill do not require a Survey Conformance Report
Reference Documents - Spec cl 2.11 WMS003 – cl3.4.5
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
3.0 - Select Fill Works – Site Won Material – Other Areas (Not Under Pavements)
Acceptance Criteria - Each Lot of fill must:
○ Not be greater than 200mm in thickness.
○ If required, material to be lightly watered to aid in compaction.
○ Placement to start on the high side.
○ Material to not be contaminated by foreign materials and other contaminants.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
○ Each intermediate layer will be visually inspected for conformance to the specification following compaction.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
○ Principles Representative to be invited to visually inspect final layer of Select Fill not under pavements.
○ At least 5m of longitudinal Select Fill and 500mm of lateral overlap of proof rolling between adjacent areas is needed.
○ If requested, Proof rolling is carried out in the presence of the Principles Representative
○ If requested, at least one working days’ notice is to be provided to schedule the presence of the Contract Administrator.
Reference Documents - Spec cl. 2.10 WMS003 – cl3.4.4.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
4.1 - Classification and Testing (imported material, under pavements only)
Acceptance Criteria - Imported Material Under Pavements
○ 4 test per lot to achieve average
○ Minimum average standard dry density ratio of no less than 98.0%.
○ No single standard dry density ratio test result being less than 97.0%.
Reference Documents - Spec cl. 2.9 AS1289 5.3.1, AS1289 5.4.1, AS1289 5.8.1, Spec tab. 2-3
Record of conformity - Test results & This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project/Site Engineer, Principles Rep Foreman
Acceptance Criteria - Principles Representative to review acceptance of lot according to table 2-3. Acceptance of lot will not hold up placing succeeding layer of subbase.
Record of conformity - Test results & This ITP signed

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
